answers.answer: Often this doesn't show up at all until the baby is born.You can rest assured that there's nothing you could have done about it,  even if it were detected earlier,  so you haven't lost valuable time.Once she's born,  they can make a decision of when to repair the lip and possibly palate.Best wishes -

It's because my doctor said a picture of the face during the 20 week ultrasound was not needed and refused to do another ultrasound to get it. The only reason I had another ultrasound was because I have gestational diabetes. If she would have been thorough we could have caught it earlier.

Right,  but it wouldn't make a difference in the long run even if you didn't catch it until she's here.Some things,  you lose valuable time and it's a real tragedy when things get missed - but in this case,  you haven't lost any time in treating her so you don't have that burden of regret -What a blessing,  too,  to know that her sweet little face can be completely repaired -
